title: Lygia Pape Weaving (Tecelar) Scarf
description:
Scarf developed from Lygia Pape’s Weaving (Tecelar) [27/03.13.01], 1955, from exhibit Lygia Pape: Tecelares at The Art Institute of Chicago.

Lygia Pape (1927–2004) was a key figure in the development of contemporary art in Brazil, dedicated to exploring new visual languages and multiple media, including painting, performance, printmaking, and sculpture.

  • Dimensions: 32 x 43 in.
  • Material: 100% polyester.
  • Care: Hand wash, hang dry.
